Topic.Title: T4 is so late, it is really DOA

Message.Msg: So the Tegra attempt #4 has a Paper Launch at the Dec. 8-11 CES show. With Jen waving a #4 in the air. Saying "Lookie, lookie". But there's no real Tegra #4 parts available -- like to Buy or anything. Oh no no no. Just vaporware and sensationalized press releases about #4 this and #4 that. . Then at the MWC show Feb. 25-28 we see ZTE and Asus become "launch partners" for the #4 -- just as they were for the unprofitable #3 and the unprofitable #2. 'Cause they like getting those free 100k or so of "engineering samples." And then the Reality sets in. That the Tegra attempt #4 is woefully late and has no integrated LTE modem. Yes boys, Woefully Late and No Cheap On-Board Radio. And that there's not much left in the way of customers. 'Cause Samsung and Qualcomm and Broadcom will have taken them all. So Jen's turtle-like Tegra/Consuming Products Business loses even more money. Than the #3 or #2 did. And remember, the Tegra #3 is on track to lose about One Third of a Billion Dollars of nvda shareholder's cash -- just for 2012. So expect the 2013 Tegra/Consuming Products Business loses to be even Larger than that. We've seen this bad movie before, right? We sure have. "Last to Market Loses the Most Money"

And Jen has already said he is ramping up the Tegra R&D more. Denver, same thing. nvda has already said there is no market in the targeted server segment, so they are now retargeting for 'HPC'. Go read Cray's 10Q, their yearly sales is only $600M, and they sell the whole system, not just one tiny chip. Denver is stillborn!

Topic.Title: How much $$ will Nvidia lose on tegra4? $99 tablets

Message.Msg: ALL ARM chip companies, with the exception of nvda, are laughing to the bank - ARM, qcom, brcm, samsung, aapl.... The only problem - AMD is dead now because they screwed up their CPU/GPU designs - too much the 'winning' AMD management expertise, you know. With nobody pushing Intel, Intel is just sitting on their laurels - no more quarterly price downs/new speed grades anymore. You know, the old Moore's law upgrade/better deal every Q.This is very bad for the whole PC industry - zero need to upgrade. For my own X'mas present, I want to upgrade my two year old laptop - but for exactly the same price as two years ago, it is almost exactly the same as my old laptop, with the exception of a slightly larger hard d and a little bit more dram. Take one guess whether I forked out the thousand $s or not.

I would like nothing more than to make money on Nvidia going long. But I just can't do it - the stock is just too expensive. - PEG above 1.3 - Current Qtr estimates have been revised down from .31 to .24 - Smartphone strategy is in tatters and 2013 is now gone with delays in Grey - Nvidia is still not repurchasing shares but continues to dilute share count - Pull a 1 Year chart and see how tenuous the technicals are, its 1 bad headline from seeing single digits I would have changed my mind if I saw a path forward to expanding profitability, insider confidence. For now its best to be on the sidelines or, play it short.
